CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 26, 1961, pg. 1, reads: "'Citizen' Wilson Departs - Seen departing the scene at 2150 Bedford Ave., after joining three officers in a high noon raid against a suspected lottery operation, Charles C. (C-for-Citizen) Wilson, whose bespectacled face is seen just about cap worn by child in foreground, grimly ignores the threats and cat-calls of outraged underworld figures who lurked around the premises.  One bystander screamed at Wilson, called him a 'b.s.o.b.!'  He shook off the attacks, departed in the police patrol car. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Police officer in doorway after raid of suspected numbers game operation, surrounded by onlookers including Charles C. Wilson wearing eyeglasses on left, at auto supply store, 2150 Bedford Avenue, Hill District
